node.description:
This flow extends the **Basic Prompting** template by adding a **Message History** component that can retrieve up to 100 previous chat messages as context for the current conversation.

## Quickstart
1. In the **Language Model** component, add your OpenAI API key, or select a different provider and model.
2. Open the **Playground**, and then tell the LLM your name.
3. Start a new chat session in the Playground, and then ask, `what is my name`. The LLM is able to retrieve your name from the stored chat history.

## About the Message History component
The **Language Model** and **Agent** components have built-in chat memory that is enabled by default and functionally the same as the **Message History** component.
Only use the **Message History** component when you want to store or retrieve chat memory from an external chat memory database, or when you need to retrieve chat memory outside of the current session context, such as in a non-chat flow or by supplying memories from other chats to a different session. For more information, see [Store chat memory](https://docs.langflow.org/memory#store-chat-memory).
Create a prompt template with dynamic variables.

mode.info: Choose variable syntax for your template.
mode.name: mode

template.name: template
template.value:
You are a helpful assistant that answer questions.

Use markdown to format your answer, properly embedding images and urls.

History: 

{memory}

tool_placeholder.info: A placeholder input for tool mode.
tool_placeholder.name: tool_placeholder

node.description: Stores or retrieves stored chat messages from Langflow tables or an external memory.

context_id.info: The context ID of the chat. Adds an extra layer to the local memory.
context_id.name: context_id

memory.info: Retrieve messages from an external memory. If empty, it will use the Langflow tables.
memory.name: memory

message.info: The chat message to be stored.
message.name: message

mode.info: Operation mode: Store messages or Retrieve messages.
mode.name: mode

sender.info: The sender of the message. Might be Machine or User. If empty, the current sender parameter will be used.
sender.name: sender

session_id.info: The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.
session_id.name: session_id

template.info: The template to use for formatting the data. It can contain the keys {text}, {sender} or any other key in the message data.
template.name: template

node.description: Runs a language model given a specified provider.

base_url_ibm_watsonx.info: The base URL of the API (IBM watsonx.ai only)
base_url_ibm_watsonx.name: base_url_ibm_watsonx

input_value.info: The input text to send to the model
input_value.name: input_value

ollama_base_url.info: Endpoint of the Ollama API (Ollama only). Defaults to http://localhost:11434
ollama_base_url.name: ollama_base_url

project_id.info: The project ID associated with the foundation model (IBM watsonx.ai only)
project_id.name: project_id

system_message.info: A system message that helps set the behavior of the assistant
system_message.name: system_message

description: Create a chatbot that saves and references previous messages, enabling the model to maintain context throughout the conversation.
name: Memory Chatbot
